title: Workday Compatibility TDD Implementation
description:
Epic for TDD-based Workday HCM compatibility layer. Since Workday API is partner-only, we use:
1. Publicly available WSDL/XSD schemas from community.workday.com
2. Alternative open APIs (BambooHR, Gusto) for pattern validation
3. Mock fixtures based on documented schemas
4. Focus on data model compatibility over exact API replication

Key Workday patterns to implement:
- Effective dating (as-of-date queries)
- Worker/Position/Organization hierarchy
- Supervisory org trees
- Job profiles linked to positions

Sources:
- Workday WWS v45.2: https://community.workday.com/sites/default/files/file-hosting/productionapi/index.html
- Human_Resources WSDL: https://community.workday.com/api
- BambooHR API: https://documentation.bamboohr.com/docs/getting-started
- Gusto Embedded: https://docs.gusto.com/embedded-payroll/docs/introduction

title: [GREEN] Implement full history queries
description:
Implement full history retrieval and diff functionality.

Implementation:
1. getHistory(entityType, entityId) -> VersionedRecord[]
   - Returns all versions ordered by effective_from DESC
   - Includes metadata: entry_timestamp, changed_by, change_reason

2. getDiff(entityType, entityId, fromDate, toDate) -> Diff
   - Compares entity state at two points in time
   - Returns field-level changes with before/after values

3. getChangeLog(entityType, entityId, options) -> ChangeEntry[]
   - Paginated change log
   - Filter by date range, field, change type

Data model:
- Store version chain with prev_version_id reference
- Index on (entity_type, entity_id, effective_from)
- Soft deletes preserve history (is_deleted flag)

Performance:
- Limit history depth for UI queries
- Archive old versions to cold storage
- Materialized current view for fast reads

Blocked by: [RED] Test historical data retrieval

title: Alternative API Compatibility Layer
description:
Epic for testing against alternative open HCM APIs to validate patterns.

Since Workday API is partner-only, we use open APIs as pattern validation:

1. BambooHR API (https://documentation.bamboohr.com)
   - REST API with public documentation
   - Employee endpoints: GET /api/v1/employees, /api/v1/employees/{id}
   - New 2025 endpoint with filtering, sorting, pagination
   - Similar patterns: employee fields, job info, departments

2. Gusto API (https://docs.gusto.com)
   - Payroll-focused with HR capabilities
   - OAuth2 authentication
   - Company/Employee/Payroll structure
   - Time-off and tax compliance APIs

3. Finch (https://tryfinch.com)
   - Unified HR API aggregator
   - Maps multiple providers to common schema
   - Good reference for normalization patterns

Strategy:
- Implement our API to be compatible with multiple providers
- Test against BambooHR/Gusto for pattern validation
- Map to Workday schema as primary interface

title: Effective Dating Core Pattern
description:
Epic for implementing Workday's effective dating pattern - the core temporal data model.

Workday effective dating concepts:
1. As Of Date - application effective date for business logic
2. As Of Moment - when data was entered into system (audit)
3. Point-in-time queries - what did data look like at date X?
4. Future-dated changes - schedule changes for future effective dates
5. Historical retrieval - full timeline of changes

For Find operations: As Of Date determines search logic
For Get operations: returns data most effective as of that date

PECI pattern: transmits each payroll change with effective date and entry date

Reference: Workday effective dating documentation

title: [GREEN] Implement as-of-date filtering
description:
Implement as-of-date filtering for point-in-time queries.

Implementation:
1. Add as_of_date parameter to all query methods
2. Store effective_from / effective_to on versioned records
3. Query filters: effective_from <= as_of_date AND (effective_to IS NULL OR effective_to > as_of_date)
4. Default as_of_date to current timestamp if not provided

Data model changes:
- Add effective_from: Date (required) to versioned entities
- Add effective_to: Date | null (null = current/active)
- Add entry_timestamp: DateTime (when record was created)

Query interface:
- getWorker(id, { as_of_date?: Date })
- findWorkers(criteria, { as_of_date?: Date })

Blocked by: [RED] Test point-in-time queries

title: [GREEN] Implement scheduled change handling
description:
Implement future-dated/scheduled change handling.

Implementation:
1. Allow creating records with effective_from > current_date
2. Scheduled changes stored but not active
3. getPendingChanges(workerId) - list scheduled future changes
4. cancelScheduledChange(changeId) - remove before effective
5. modifyScheduledChange(changeId, updates) - update before effective

Data model:
- Scheduled changes have effective_from > now
- Active record has effective_from <= now AND effective_to IS NULL
- Transition: when effective_from arrives, activate scheduled record

Background job pattern:
- Option 1: Lazy evaluation (check effective_from on each query)
- Option 2: Background activation (cron activates scheduled changes)
- Recommendation: Lazy evaluation for simplicity

Blocked by: [RED] Test future-dated changes

title: Document schema differences from real Workday
description:
Create documentation of schema differences between our implementation and real Workday.

Documentation should include:

1. Simplified fields
   - Which Workday fields are omitted
   - Why (complexity, partner-only, rarely used)

2. Type differences
   - Workday uses SOAP with complex types
   - We use JSON with simpler structures
   - Document mapping between types

3. Naming conventions
   - Workday: Pascal_Case with underscores
   - Our API: camelCase for JSON
   - Document field name mappings

4. Reference handling
   - Workday uses WID (Workday ID) references
   - We use simpler string IDs
   - Document reference resolution differences

5. Feature gaps
   - Business processes not implemented
   - Integrations not supported
   - Security model differences

6. Alternative API mappings
   - How our schema maps to BambooHR
   - How our schema maps to Gusto
   - Common fields across all three

Output: docs/schema-differences.md in rewrites/workday/
